TopicTitle: Atlas I Heavy from BluPlanet Inc.

Articles.Content:
Rocket engineer startreader presents the Atlas 1 heavy launch vehicle. This huge rocket is capable of carrying an estimate of 120 tons into orbit, maybe more, maybe less. It's capabilities have not been fully tested, but it can take an Jumbo 64 tank to Minmus:

It's good for refueling stations by serving as a launch vehicle for fuel tankers, as well as other missions which have a heavy payload.

Total delta-V estimated to be 9550 m/s

Struts highly recommended...

Make sure the solid rocket boosters and the first pair of asparagus staging both run out before dropping first stage!

CREDIT: Startreader

Enjoy! Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/gfqetmzggdi6k4k/SHLS%20Atlas.craft

Edited June 24, 2013 by Kerbol Prime
Atlas II is now under construction, bigger, stronger, and with more oomph, even Jeb's gonna be impressed

I doubt it's actually capable of carrying 150 tons to orbit.

make sure you get some reliable data for Atlas II

I doubt it's actually capable of carrying 150 tons to orbit.

make sure you get some reliable data for Atlas II

Apologies sir, I was using data from the builder. I'll get to work and fully test it out.
